file_content.text: With Torvix dead, his people are scattered. Nicely done.
Static on all channels.
Councillor Torvix is dead, and his army is a mess. It won't be long before we make a clean sweep.
When this operation is over... Corellia will be an overpopulated rock unable to power its own fleets.
Torvix's army is fragmented, but someone will try to pull it together. We can't allow that.
Don't let Torvix be replaced.
I'll make sure to keep the pressure on.
It doesn't trouble you, seeing your homeworld devastated?
You're from Corellia, though.
I brought Corellia to the Empire, and Corellia turned on me. It's not my home anymore.
After everything that happened, this planet should be wiped clean.
Corellia deserves worse.
But that's not an option, this time.
Anyway, there's plenty more for us to do--and you've given us the chance to do it.
I'll be the last one off the planet--but if I don't make it, at least Torvix died first.
You've got their attention. Torvix's bodyguards are getting angry.
This is Torvix to security--what are you doing? We have intruders!
This is Torvix to all forces. I'm sealing the inner vault. Deal with the problem.
The bird is in the nest. Time to flood Torvix's command center with hypermatter--sending you the details.
This is Torvix. What do you think you're doing? You can't unseal my vault!
Listen to me--we can still negotiate. The explosion will kill us all!
That should do it. Hypermatter pipes flooding--and igniting.
Damn you! You're dead, do you hear me? Dead!
Mission accomplished. Come on home.
Torvix has had this coming a long time. Good luck.
My lord? There's a transmission from the Black Hole... the general wants it put through to you.
Sir? There's a transmission from the Black Hole... the general wants it put through to you.
So you're the Sith Lord who's been hounding me.
So a Dark Council member is finally paying attention.
So you're the ghost who's been haunting my people.
I heard it was a bounty hunter who'd been troubling me. I hope you have some pull with the Empire.
I'm Councillor Torvix. It's time to end this--you want the Black Hole facilities destroyed, and you know I can hold out forever. So we negotiate.
Your forces can't stand against us. And the Republic is closing in as fast as we are.
You're already losing.
When the Republic realizes it can't beat me, I'll be ruler of Corellia. This is your last chance.
State your terms, Councillor.
I'm amenable to negotiation.
You pledged to serve the Empire. You betrayed your oath. There is no negotiation.
Your treason is your death.
You'll reconsider. You need what I have.
Men beg for an audience with the Lords of the Dark Council. Do you think yourself above me?
I'm Sith. You are nothing.
I think I have the upper hand, because I have the fuel your ships need.
Analyze the frequency and run a locator, but keep it quiet.
Trace this call, Private.
I'm listening, Councillor.
You want to negotiate, start paying more than the Imperials. Then we can talk.
I'll consider a bribe.
I have my own mercenaries already, thank you.
By the end of the day, the Empire will provide me with shield generators, combat droids, anti-air cannons and access to orbital satellites.
In return, I will release one-tenth of my hypermatter stores to your fleet, and you will depart this system forever.
Desperate son of a sow just made his biggest mistake. We traced the signal and got a bead on his position.
What do you say to killing Councillor Torvix?
We haven't been able to reach him so far. You have an idea?
Tell me your plan.
He must know he's near defeat. We can call his bluff and force him to surrender.
Diplomacy is an option.
With respect? I served in the cabinet with Torvix for seven years. He doesn't know when to quit.
General Konya--you may have lost Corellia, but there's hope for you yet.
For once, a good idea.
You're too kind.
Torvix is using a radiation vault as his command center--impervious to portable weaponry, but not to a hypermatter detonation.
Take out his personal guards--let him know you're coming and he'll seal his shelter. Then flood the hypermatter pipelines and turn him into ash.
There's more to it than that. What am I facing?
Anything else I should know?
If it comes to killing, I'll deal the blow. This could still end another way.
I'll decide whether he dies.
So long as it's over.
His guards are killers--the worst pirates in Republic space, armored in radiation suits or from some species immune to everything. The rest? Just his army.
Councillor Torvix will die. Corellia will burn. And the Republic will be left with nothing.
Let's end all of this.
All I could hope for.
I'll be in touch during the approach. Scorch his bones for me.
Last bottle from the Coronet City Winery is over there. One drink before we jump into the abyss?
They're here.
She's here.
He's here.
General. You ordered the Empire's withdrawal from Corellia?
That's right. You must be the Emperor's Wrath--and since I'm not dead yet, I suppose I owe you an explanation.
Dark Lord. Didn't expect you to come in person; I hope you'll hear me out before the execution.
That's right. And you're ex-Intelligence, ex-military... I can't even pull files on you, so I hope inviting you here wasn't my worst move yet.
If you're after my head, I've already put credits in your account; does that buy me time to talk?
General Adele Konya, formerly of the Corellian cabinet and commander of Horizon Outpost. We may be withdrawing, but we can still be victorious.
I'm told you're staging some sort of suicide mission. You said you needed help.
I received your message.
You have no idea.
How did a former cabinet member become an Imperial general?
You're Corellian?
I thought the Empire would be good for my planet, and when General Hesker was reassigned... Darth Marr needed someone in place. Lucky me.
We fought and died to take this planet. Retreat is not the way.
We shouldn't be withdrawing.
We could hold Corellia--but after what happened on Ilum and Denova, the Empire is fragmented. We have to regroup.
We're stationed on the edge of the Black Hole--an industrial site used to store and process hypermatter. Volatile, toxic and key to lightspeed travel.
We've sacked and burned almost everything on Corellia. Without the Black Hole, Corellian fleets will go without fuel and the planet will be isolated.
Seize the hypermatter and destroy the facilities. The Imperial fleet regroups, and the Republic is weighed down by a worthless planet.
We leave the Republic nothing.
That was the plan, anyway.
Straightforward enough. Why do you need me?
So what's the problem?
Do you regret betraying your homeworld, General?
Am I hearing bitterness?
I'm Imperial now, and the Sith don't teach regret.
Our problem is Councillor Torvix. The most corrupt man in the Corellian cabinet--recruited a criminal army for the Empire when the invasion started.
Torvix and his allies used Imperial equipment and weaponry to take control of the Black Hole. Now he refuses to give up what power he has.
If we're going to ruin Torvix and obtain the hypermatter, I need to know everything.
Give me a tactical report.
Torvix's men are mostly pirates and Exchange gangsters using our tech. We've got limited resources, and we're surrounded by the Republic.
What can Torvix hope to achieve? The Republic won't take him back.
What does he plan to do?
He thinks he can still negotiate a deal--it doesn't matter that he's wrong.
Two Corellian councillors who signed on with the Empire... one clinging to power, the other desperate for a chance to prove her worth.
You two have a lot in common.
I ran out of chances a while ago--but unlike Torvix, I chose my side and stuck to it.
We need to take Torvix down, siphon off his hypermatter and ruin his facilities--all with limited resources and while surrounded by the Republic.
Most of our troops are already gone--I've retained a few specialists, but we won't get out alive. You can help us die martyrs instead of failures.
You failed to hold Corellia. Whether you live or die now isn't my concern.
I'm not here to save you.
Nor mine. We agree on that much.
My people are at your command. For the Empire.
Everyone gets out alive.
The Empire's lost too many loyal soldiers. If there's a way to succeed and evacuate your people safely, we'll find it.
You hire me, and I do this job right. That includes keeping the team in one piece.
Then let's get to work. My people are at your command.
For the Empire!
This is Horizon Outpost. Edge of the Black Hole.
